metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5827 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in SQLite via WebSQL in Google Chrome prior to74.0.3729.131 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

lemon - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.2
libsqlite3-0 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.2
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.2
sqlite3 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
sqlite3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-1ubuntu0.2').
sqlite package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
